#summary User guide: Psi and PyICQt

First, you should have a jabber account. Have no one? Free register at one from a [http://www.jabberes.org/servers/ servers] (also, check features, supported by this server)

Ok. You are registered at jabber server and it have an ICQ transport:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi0.png]

Log-in and execute Service Discovery for your server:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi1.png]

I'm use local test server for transports and will hide all its URLs :)
You see ICQ transport in disco results? The register at it:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi2.png]

Type yours UIN and password:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi3.png]

You are registered at transport. Now you should Auth it and wait some seconds while transport logging into ICQ network.
ICQ users will auto adds in roster:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi4.png]

Already possible post messages to your frends. But, of course, PyICQt can do more. These 'additional' features available via _Ad-Hoc_ commands:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi5.png]

After registration default settings applied to your account. Check them:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi6.png]

For example, I enabled x-status support:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi7.png]

You can see x-status of contact across tooltip at contact nickname:
[http://pyicqt.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/img/UserGuidePsi/Psi8.png]

Yes, it's a short manual. Have a questions? Post comments!
